title: Miscellaneous Challenge
description: How do we create a space for ideas and projects that do not fit any of the other current Challenges?

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is clear and is going to position proposals that don't fit into the challenge category .
I agree.
f6_assessments.q1:
The catalyst community have the capacity to address the challenge. This particular proposal solution was discussed in the last TownHall.
I agree
f6_assessments.q2:
The suggested metrics are set correctly to measure progress.
I agree

f6_assessments.q0:
A miscellaneous challenge could align with any aspect of the Cardano mission. By challenge definition there is no overlap with any other successful challenges. In order for the community to push innovation boundaries there will need to be solutions that do not easily fit into categories. Given the limitations of the current funding process and the lengthy time for funding it is possible that a key funding challenge category does not receive funding for 3 months. This category could act as a failsafe.
I strongly agree this challenge is critical to achieve Cardano's mission.
f6_assessments.q1:
Under the current decentralized funding model with voters voting on specific challenge proposals instead of balanced challenge proposal packages, it is quite likely that there will be fund rounds where entire categories of challenges unintentionally go unfunded. This category is a badly needed failsafe. The 200K funding request is too small for its failsafe role. I recommend 10% of Total Fund for future rounds.
I strongly agree that the Catalyst community has the capacity to address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q2:
The success criteria are relevant to the challenge question.
The key metrics are relevant to the success criteria and measurable.  
I  strongly agree that the success criteria and suggested metrics are set correctly to measure progress in addressing the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: The fact that some ideas need to be in a miscellaneous challenge is critical to Catalyst to be more democratic. Therefore, the proposal has good alignment with Cardano's mission. Setting up a challenge that is open, is a chance to contemplate proposers around the world that cover topics beyond the "traditional" crypto-developer space. Therefore, creating this challenge is a way to decentralize funding resources - which I think is a great north for the community.
f6_assessments.q1: The challenge is feasible but lacks explanations on how it will be implemented, what are resources needed, or how they will be applied. It seems to rely on CA to be implemented, then it can be seen as an alignment between the community that requires good orientation to avoid "free-funding-to-whatever-you-ask-for". The proposers could provide more details on how it will fit into Catalyst's program approach. There's is the capacity to implement this challenge, but a bit more of detailing in the proposal would make it more appealing as a challenge that solves the issue of projects that don't fit into any other challenges. Another question is that it could make it easy for lazy proposers to tag their proposals as "miscellaneous" without caring too much about the work done so far to build the Catalyst Community and the structure of project funding.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics are clear: projects that are submitted and funded in this challenge but wouldn't be successful in any other challenge. But the proponents do not clarify what happens if this challenge receives much more proposals submitted than it should.

importance: Creating a Miscellaneous Challenge could enable great ideas to be funded in a specific Fund, even if they don't fit any other Challenge.
success: Funding great ideas that focus on problems that are not covered by any other Challenge.
